SENT.plain: Basilar artery thrombosis has a very poor prognosis
A 56-year-old comatose man with acute basilar artery occlusion was successfully treated with local urokinase infusion which reopened the basilar artery and revealed a midbasilar stenotic plaque
This procedure was followed by a superficial temporal artery to superior cerebellar artery anastomosis for protection of the posterior circulation
